title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1153.4 - Explosive cargo
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1153.4 - Explosive cargo

State Regulations

No person shall, without prior permission, keep, transport, handle or store at, in or upon a terminal any cargo of explosives or other
dangerous articles which is barred from loading in or transportation by civil
aircraft, watercraft or motor vehicle in the United States under the current
provisions of part 103 of the Federal aviation regulations promulgated by the

Federal Aviation Administration and the United States Coast Guard. Any waiver
of such regulations or of any part thereof by the Federal Aviation

Administration, the United States Coast Guard or by any other competent
authority shall not constitute or be construed to constitute a waiver of this
section or an implied permission to keep, transport, handle or store such
explosives or other dangerous articles at, in or upon a terminal. Advance
notice of at least 24 hours shall be given the manager to permit full
investigation and clearance for any operation requiring a waiver of this
rule. Notes

1153.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
